result.execSummary:
The defendant Akasha Desire Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to undergo a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment/counseling.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to take all prescribed medications as prescribed.  The Defendant is to maintain full time employment of at least 40 hours per week. Defendant is to have no contact with M.N., I.M. and S.M. unless approved by agent.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  Law Enforcement Office must assist in securing personal property.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety for pendency of case, except for prescribed medication.
